name: Enviro Shield / Prime P2 / Epoxy B-LV
template name: Enviro Shield / Prime P2 / Epoxy B-LV

name: Relevant Australian Standards Checked
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet

Check substrate. The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles including dust, laitance, grease, coatings, curing compounds and any other foreign matter. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns)
Attach Photo
Apply primer (Enviro Shield/Enviro prime P2 or Enviro Epoxy B-LV) by brush/roller
Attach Photo
Caulking. Apply Enviro Flex FC junction fillets (where applicable)
Attach Photo
Mixing and Application. Mix Enviro 700 thoroughtly using mechanical mixer. Apply Enviro 700X using brush/roller achieving 1.6mm WFT / 1.5mm DFT.
Attach Photo
Testing. Flood test when applicable.
Attach Photo
First signoff. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles.
Check Screed (moisture test if required, Enviro Shield is moisture tolerant.)
Attach Photo
Apply first coat of Enviro Shield with a brush or roller.
Attach Photo
Apply second coat of Enviro Shield with a brush or roller.
Attach Photo
Protection board. Install Elmich Versidrain 8 Geo
Attach Photo
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF
